news.title: Trump reverses stance on Epstein records, presses Republicans to support release
news.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has called on Congressional Republicans to vote to release files related to deceased convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

news.title: Stock futures are little changed to start the week: Live updates
news.description: The moves followed a choppy week in which valuation fears, a rotation within the market and a recalibration of Fed rate cut expectations pressured the AI trade.

news.title: All three of the core premises behind the bull market are coming under questioning
news.description: Mike Santoli breaks down the recent turbulence seen in the market and whether it is a sign of a bigger washout to come.

news.title: Alibaba is helping Chinese military target the U.S., White House memo claims: FT
news.description: The Financial Times cited a White House memo that alleged Alibaba was providing tech support to Chinese military 'operations' against targets in the U.S.

news.title: Former Fed Gov. Adriana Kugler violated trading rules while at central bank: ethics report
news.description: The Federal Reserve's internal watchdog was notified earlier this year about stock trades from 2024 disclosed by then-Gov Adriana Kugler.

news.title: Goldman Sachs unveils its 10-year playbook — and AI is at the heart of it
news.description: Cyclical forces periodically influence markets, but Goldman Sachs expect long-term drivers to be structural.

news.title: Japan to dispatch senior envoy to China, NHK says, as travel warning drives tourism selloff in Tokyo
news.description: Japan's tourism-related stocks fell amid worsening diplomatic standoff between the two nations after Beijing issued a travel and study advisory.

news.title: Japan's economy contracts for the first time in six quarters as exports, residential investment drag
news.description: On an annualized basis, private demand fell 1.8%, dragged lower by a more than 32% drop in residential investments.

news.title: Asia-Pacific markets trade mixed as investors assess intensifying China-Japan tensions
news.description: Asia-Pacific markets were set to open lower on Monday as investors look toward a slate of economic data in the region.

news.title: CNBC Daily Open: The laws of politics can be changed, but not economics
news.description: Just as AI steps away from the spotlight, tariffs entered the stage, like the next act in a Shakespearean play.

news.title: New York Fed met with Wall Street firms about key lending facility: FT
news.description: The Fed sought feedback from dealers on the use of the central bank's standing repo facility, a permanent lending tool that acts as a backstop for markets.

news.title: Inside Ford's new world headquarters: Scratch kitchens, rotisserie chickens and design secrets
news.description: Ford's new 2.1-million-square-foot headquarters in Dearborn, Michigan, is ceremoniously opening Sunday, although construction is expected to continue into 2027.

news.title: The government shutdown is over. The air traffic controller shortage is not
news.description: Staffing shortages of air traffic controllers forced airlines to chop flights and delay thousands of others that disrupted travel plans of 5 million people.

news.title: Woman pleads guilty to lying about astronaut wife accessing bank account from Space Station
news.description: Summer Worden faces a possible maximum sentence of five years in prison in the case, which involves false allegations she made against astronaut Anne McClain.

news.title: September jobs report will be out Thursday as first data since shutdown starts to trickle out
news.description: The departments of Labor and Commerce had not posted revised schedules as of Friday morning, but updates are expected soon.

news.title: Trump tariffs are helping drive U.S. beef prices to new highs
news.description: President Trump's tariffs are adding to higher beef prices, along with drought and parasites in a stressed U.S. beef supply chain.

news.title: Atlanta Fed President Bostic says he'll leave position when his term expires in February
news.description: Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic said Wednesday he will be leaving his position when his term expires in February.

news.title: The shutdown put jobs and inflation data on hold. Here's when it could be back — and what it might say
news.description: Economic data releases — payroll and jobs reports, CPI and PPI — have lagged during the government shutdown and likely will take some time to get rolling again.

news.title: 'Ghost job' postings are adding another layer of uncertainty to the stalling jobs picture
news.description: Since the beginning of 2024, job openings have outnumbered hires by more than 2.2 million a month.

news.title: Stock investors are buoying the economy. A labor market breakdown could end that
news.description: Government labor data could paint a darker economic picture, leading to a market slide that would throw cold water on the outlook of those who are well off.

news.title: Americans are heating their homes with bitcoin this winter
news.description: Winter across the U.S. means big bills for home heating oil, gas and electric furnaces, but in some cases, crypto like bitcoin is paying to keep Americans warm.

news.title: These underperforming groups may deliver AI-electric appeal. Here's why.
news.description: Industrial and infrastructure stocks may soon share the spotlight with the artificial intelligence trade.

news.title: How tariffs and AI are giving secondhand platforms like ThredUp a boost
news.description: Tariffs are driving shoppers to resale platforms in the U.S., and companies like ThredUp are cashing in.

news.title: AI anxiety on the rise: Startup founders react to bubble fears
news.description: Short sellers like Michael Burry and Jim Chanos are circling, warning that the AI buildout isn’t a one-time investment but a recurring cost wave.

news.title: Google and Disney reach deal to restore ESPN, ABC to YouTube TV
news.description: The deal comes after a two-week standoff that resulted in channels like ESPN, ABC and others going dark on the popular YouTube TV streaming service.

news.title: Data centers are concentrated in these states. Here's what's happening to electricity prices
news.description: Residential utility bills rose 6% on average nationwide in August compared with the same period last year, according to the Energy Information Administration.

news.title: Border Patrol commander touts dozens of North Carolina arrests, leaving residents 'overwhelmed'
news.description: A top Border Patrol commander touted dozens of arrests in North Carolina's largest city on Sunday.

news.title: Trump buys at least $82 million in bonds since late August, financial disclosures show
news.description: Trump bought at least $82 million in corporate and municipal bonds from late August to early October, financial disclosures made public on Saturday showed.

news.title: MAGA rift grows as Trump feuds with Marjorie Taylor Greene before key 2026 midterm elections
news.description: President Donald Trump has called it quits with one of his most stalwart MAGA-world supporters, calling Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene "'Wacky' Marjorie."
